maqras.text: Glorify the name of your Lord, the most High
The One Who created (everything), then (fashioned and) set everything right
Assigned (everything its) nature, then guided it along
The One Who produces the fodder
Then turns it into the decaying scum
(Oh prophet)! We would enable you to recite (the Qur´an). Then, you will not forget (anything)
Except whatever Allah wills. Indeed, He knows the apparent, as well as the concealed
And We will make it easy for you (to adopt) the easy way
So remind (men), for reminder surely helps
The one who fears, will surely heed
And the wretched will stay aloof
And then he will roast in the mammoth fire
Where he shall never die; nor be alive
Successful has been the one who purified himself
And, remembered the name of his Lord and performed the ´salat´
No! In fact, (most of) you prefer the life of this world
Although the hereafter _ (the life-to-come) _ is far superior and more enduring
Certainly, this (is what) was (written) in the earlier scriptures
The scriptures of Ibraheem and Musa
Has the news of that overwhelming (calamity) reached you
(Many) faces that day would be (panic struck and) down cast
Weary and toiling
Burning in the scorching fire
Made to drink from the boiling spring
And having nothing to eat, except (the bitter thorny) cactus
Not enough to nourish or curb the hunger
(Other) faces that day would be happy (and blissful)
Well pleased with (the outcome of) their efforts
In the exalted paradise
There, they shall hear nothing vile or foolish
In paradise, there are gushing springs
And elevated thrones
And carved (exotic) goblets
And cushions set in rows
And spread out (lush rich) carpets
Do they not look at the camel (and wonder)? How (superbly) is it created
And at the sky; how (high) is it raised
And at the mountains; how (firmly) are they planted
And at the earth; how (wide) is it spread out
So, (continue to) remind (them). Indeed, you are (a messenger) to remind (them)
You are not (appointed) a warden over them
As for the one who turns away and disbelieves
Allah will punish him with the direst torment
Of course, back to Us is their return (journey)
Indeed, to call them to accounts is upon Us
(I swear by) the dawn
The ten nights (of the month of ´Hajj´)
Even and odd (numbers)
And the night as it passes
Is there a (more solemn) vow for the sensible ones
Are you not aware of what your Lord did to the (people of) ´Aads´
Those well known for the high pillars (of their architecture)
Such that the likes of them had never been raised in other cities
And (how He dealt) with the people of ´Samood´, who hollowed out huge rocks (and built palaces) in the valley
And with the pharaoh wielding the kingdom
Those who transgressed and crossed all bounds in the lands
And vastly increased mischief and corruption in the land
So your Lord unleashed upon them the scourge of suffering
Indeed, your Lord is ever so vigilant
Such is man! When his Lord puts him through a test by granting him honor and a life of ease, he says, "My Lord has honored me
And when He tests him by restricting his means of livelihood, he says, "My Lord has disgraced me
Not at all! In fact, you do not treat the orphans kindly
Nor do you encourage each other to feed the poor
Greedily, you (misappropriate and) devour the inheritance (of the weak, the widows and the orphans)
You love wealth with all your heart
No, of course not! (On the day) when the earth is pounded repeatedly and crushed
And your Lord (Himself) comes down, along with His angels ranked in rows
And (the day) the hell is brought (in view), is the day when man shall remember clearly. But rememberance then will be of no avail
Man will say, "Alas! If only I had sent ahead of me (the good deeds) for this life of mine
No one can punish (as severely) as He will, that day
No one can tie up and bind as (securely as) He will (that day)
(The righteous would be told), "Oh you, the tranquil peaceful soul
Return to your Lord contented and happy, having won His pleasure
Join My (honored) servants
And enter My (idyllic blissful) paradise
